intro: Phymatopsis wuyishanica, commonly known as the Wuyi mountain phymatopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Fujian Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
